body_content.explanation: in a way that is more important, strong, or noticeable than anything else of the same type:
examples: She uses dominantly blue and grey tones in her paintings.
The storytelling is accompanied by sound effects created by flutes, a guitar and, most dominantly, drums.

body_content.explanation: (of a gene) in a way that always produces a particular characteristic in a person, plant, or animal:
examples: The condition is passed on to children dominantly.
It is a dominantly inherited form of diabetes, that mostly affects young people.

body_content.explanation: A part of the body that is used dominantly is used more, or has more effect than a body part of the same type on the other side of the body:
examples: Handedness is defined as the hand that carries out most tasks dominantly.
The people in the study seemed to be more dominantly right-brained or left-brained.
